awd_titl_txt: Advances in Data Science: Theory, Methods and Computation
awd_abstract_narration:
Due to advancements in data acquisition techniques over the last two decades, new types of exceedingly complex datasets have emerged and present tremendous challenges that require synergy of interdisciplinary ideas for analysis and decision making. As a result, the field of data-science is rapidly evolving as an interdisciplinary field, where advances often result from combinations of ideas from multiple disciplines. A convening of leading experts, early-career researchers, and students from varied disciplines to exchange ideas is essential for progress in this field. Texas A&M University will host a two-day conference on Advances in Data Science in February 2022. More information on the conference can be found at  https://stat.tamu.edu/advances-in-data-science-conference/.
 
The primary objective of the conference is to provide a much-needed platform for accelerating the depth and quality of research on the foundations of data science through interdisciplinarity. The conference will bring together researchers from three major disciplinary areas (Statistics, Mathematics and Engineering) for presentation and dissemination of their research, to engage in discussions and foster future collaborations. This conference will involve women, minorities and young researchers across the nation. The conference will present a tremendous opportunity for first generation undergraduate students to be inspired and pursue careers in data-science in both academia and industry.  The conference will feature a number of activities to engage the students and recognize their contributions through awards.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

por.por_cntn:
The Department of Statistics at Texas A&M along with FIDS institute (https://fids.tamu.edu/) organized the conference on "Advances in Data Science - theory, methods and computation on October 21-22, 2022 at the Hilton Hotel and Conference Center at College Station. The conference featured 5 keynote talks (Ed George, Moshe Verdi, Ryan Tibshirani, James Scott, Peter Hoff) who are world-renowned experts in various disciplines under the broader topic of data-science.  In addition, 8 invited sessions were organized by faculty members in the Department of Statistics and the FIDS institute on cutting edge topics such as approximate Bayesian inference, matrix/tensor modeling, machine learning in healthcare, spatial statistics, to name a few.  Over 200 participants (including students and postdocs) from all over the country attended the conference. A two hour long poster session is held on the evening of the first day of the conference. Travel support was provided to around 25 graduate students who presented posters.  In addition, all the  invited speakers are partially re-imbursed for their travel and accommodation. A detailed agenda can be found here: https://iamcs.tamu.edu/conference-on-advances-in-data-science-theory-methods-and-computation/.  

 

The participants of the conferences are chosen to be diverse in terms of their expertise, background, gender and geographical location as much as possible. The project supported travel and local expenses for the poster presentors who mostly are graduate students and postdocs across the nation.  In addition, travel expenses for the invited speakers (a significant percentage of whom are junior researchers) and partially reimbursed.  One of the main outcomes is to expose graduate students, postdocs and junior researchers to the fore-front of the cutting edge areas in data-science and to provide them the opportunity to interact and build connections and potential future collaborations.  The conference not only played a crucial role in strengthening connections of Texas A&M with neighboring universities such as Rice, UT Austin and MD Anderson Cancer Center, but also with quite a few universities across the nation. 


Last Modified: 06/29/2023
Modified by: Moumita Karmakar
